code.description: Open Visual Studio Code. You can use code . for current directory.

nvim.description: Open Neovim. You can use nvim <file> for opening file in neovim. Or nvim to enter neovim.

tmux.description: Terminal multiplexer. Create tmux session with $ tmux new -s <session_name>. Use $ tmux attach -t <session_name> to attach to session.

less.description: Less is more. It's a pager. You can use less <file> to open file in less.

rm.description: Remove files. rm *.<type> will delete all kinds of files. You can use rip instead of rm.

rmdir.description: Remove directory. rmdir <dir> will remove empty directory. For non-empty directory, use rm -rf <dir>.

mkdir.description: Make directory. mkdir <dir> will create a directory with name dir.

touch.description: Create a file. touch <file> will create a file with name file.

mv.description: Move files. mv <file> <dir> will move file to directory. mv <file1> <file2> will rename file1 to file2.

cp.description: Copy files. cp <file> <dir> will copy file to directory.

cat.description: Cat stands for concatenate. Cat <file> will show file contents. cat <file1> <file2> will concatenate file1 and file2.

echo.description: Echo. echo <string> will print string. echo 'string' > <file> will write string to file.

grep.description: Grep. grep <pattern> <file> will search for pattern in file.

find.description: Find. find <dir> -name <file> will search for file in directory.

ls.description: List. ls will list files in directory. ls -a will list all files including hidden files.

cd.description: Change directory. cd <dir> will change directory to dir. cd .. will go to parent directory.

pwd.description: Print working directory. pwd will show current directory.

clear.description: Clear screen. clear will clear the terminal screen. It basically jumps down but you can always scroll up to see previous commands and work.

exit.description: Exit. exit will close the terminal.

whoami.description: Who am I. whoami will show the current user.

man.description: Manual for each command. It provides a detailed view of the command.
